intro: Lithospermum approximatum, commonly known as narrowleaf lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots contain compounds such as lithospermic acid, which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
